Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Services!”
Reviews.Author: Faouzibhh
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Services: Valet Parking; Concierge (Solomon); Bellman (Brian); Barman (Tyler); hotel car driver (Angel); etc. Very nice rooms with a very relaxing white color furniture feeling like in movie studios. Nice view. Located in a nice residential area. You need a good 20mn walk too get to Rodeo Drive shopping street, but the hotel offers a complementary car and driver service from 10am to 10pm, within 5 miles area from the hotel, which is quite convenient. Rooms are ok for 4 persons, although beds are not really Queen size... Very nice garden! Breakfast is expensive and only "A la carte", it misses the Buffet formula and some healthy items, such as not fat yougurt, or a larger tea flavors choices. Serviced at Breakfast contrasts with the remaining services. Valet parking is very great service but quite expensive: $35/night! Only 1 restaurant with an excellent quality, but expensive, so you need to eat outside the hotel. It would be helpful for a family of 4 to have another restaurant with a buffet formula or less expensive meals. We still keep an excellent souvenir of this exceptional hotel and do really recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Mr. C Beverly Hills will be my choice again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Mondani
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel has a great combination of classic and trendy, stylish, warmth and homeliness. I`ve stayed there twice, last time in March for two weeks and I will always choose Mr. C when I travel to LA. Rooms are perfectly clean, classy and comfortable with service twice a day. All rooms have a balcony. Concierges, front desk, bellman, housekeeping, actually everyone there is always greeting you with a friendly smile and always at your service. The concierges Solomon and Choi are always helpful, they give you OUTSTANDING service and are the friendliest concierges I’ve ever encountered on my many travels. Solomon really stands out. When I left it felt like leaving an amazing friend who only wants the best for you. He made Mr C feel like my home away from home. Mr. C is located in a beautiful residential neighborhood with perfect access to Beverly Hills and West Hollywood. Walking distance to Rodeo Drive and the house car takes guests within a 3 mile radius from the hotel. The house car driver Angel made sure every ride was comfortable and he was always friendly too. The restaurant is really worth a visit also. Italian style with white linen furnished tables and tasty Italian food. According to Haute Living Mr. C brings class to Italian dining and listed MR C among the Top 5 Italian Eats in LA. They should have been number one. Looks like the restaurant and bar/lobby is also very popular among the “locals” and have lots of returning guests. I can`t wait to go back and I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Quite underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: champagnetravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a recent trip to the U.S.. Flew in from Vegas where we stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, also a 5 star hotel. Apart from the obvious design/decor differences these two hotels couldn't be more different in terms of being a "5 star hotel" First impressions were good, the Valet guys are friendly and efficient. Escorted to the lobby of the hotel where the check in happened at the bar. 2 complimentary bellini's. Presented in 2 short (almost shot-size) glasses. I would have prefered champagne glasses. Prior to arriving at the hotel I was in touch with their concierge as I had some concerns from other reviewers about noise etc. They were helpful and advised we booked a premier view room (the most expensive) that faced the front of the hotel as they were deemed to be quieter. The rooms facing the other side of the hotel looks out over a very busy main road. (the actual size of the rooms are exactly the same though) the premium you pay is for rest and peace. Fine. Our room was on the 11th floor- again, requested by me to avoid noise issues. We had a corner room so had a lovely view of Beverly Hills. The Hollywood sign is a lot further than I thought- had to really squint to see it. I loved the decor of the room, Frank Sinatra/Old hollywood and the actual size of the room was perfect. No bath but it didn't bother us as I never bother with a bath on holiday. In terms of the cleanliness of the room, sad to report that it didn't live up to 5 star standards.. I found a couple of hairs IN the bed. (yes, i'm OCD and inspect a bed before getting into it) and general "bits" on the floor. Pictures indicate a sofa in the bedrooms- we had a chair. Not a big deal but would have prefered a sofa as we ordered room service one night and it would have made eating it at the table a lot easier. Since I'm on the topic- room service: No nice way of saying this- it was crap. HORRIBLE. To be fair, from other reviewers, i didn't expect anything amazing but this was truly awful. I had the Tagliardi with Veal Ragύ - a lump of pasta with un-seasoned, bland sauce. Could have been anything. Husband had the grilled chicken which was dry and didn't come with anything! I guess you could argue that the golden rule is to always have a burger/club sandwich when ordering room service but since they rave about the restaurant..erm, really? We used the house car a couple of times- lovely driver. Valet was generally very quick with our car and possibly the highlight of our stay. (We did tip very generously which might have helped) Went down to the bar for a drink on the second day, sat for absolutely ages with no barman in sight. After about 10 minutes of waiting I stopped a member of staff walking by and asked if there was a danger of us getting served.. he turned out to be a manager of some sort.. grumbled about the bar man being "missing".. lots of faffing about before finally coming 'round to the bar and pouring our drinks himself. Moaned to us that the bar man must be on a "break" somewhere. 5 star service you say... They did give us the drinks free in the end, but really?? We have to chase someone to get us a drink? whilst sitting AT THE BAR?? We were getting ready to go out on our second night when the sound of thumping latin music filled the air. Our neighbours decided to throw a party.. We had a connecting door in our room to the room next door so they might has well have been IN our room the noise was so loud! We could hear every single word they shouted over the music. Great. So much for paying a PREMIUM to be away from the noise. Absolutely no sound proofing whatsoever. We spoke to reception about our concerns and they offered to move us to a different room once we get back from dinner (midnight?) or housekeeping could move our stuff whilst we were out. Not sure how they thought that could work? I had 20days worth of clothes/shoes/bags all over the room. (yes, i travel like a diva..) point being, we would then had to sort everything out upon our return as we had a early flight in the morning so we declined. My husband suggested we go to dinner and hopefully things would have calmed down upon our return. Thankfully, this was the case. Not sure if the hotel had a hand in this but if they did- good on them. However this shouldn't be a issue in the first place!! There was no noise issue at all at the Mandarin Oriental, despite being in VEGAS and our suite being next to the lift. 5 star done right! Lastly, upon checking out I advised the receptionist that I wanted to pay the balance of our stay on my bank cash card. (they swiped my credit card upon check-in for "incidentals").. a day later, after landing in San Fran, i discovered the hotel took over £500 (about $700) from my cash card!!!! We called them up and they said this was standard procedure to cover incidentals? wtf? We CHECKED OUT! we have LEFT the hotel? You already charged my credit card for this when we checked in?? Why charge our card???? This conversation went on and on for about 20min with no reasonable explanation. We demanded the money returned to our card. It got returned- 4 weeks later. This money was put onto my cash card as spending money! Meant we had £500 less to spend on our holiday. Unacceptable. I'll end the review on a positive- we left some important documents at the hotel and they send it to us by fedex the next day. (we were charged a premium) I rely heavily on tripadvisor for my bookings so I hope after reading this you will be able to make a informed decision. I have tried to contact the hotel with my concerns but they have not replied. This isn't the worst hotel in the world but if you go expecting 5 star service/luxury you're in for a shock.

Reviews.Title: “The restaurant bar has the finest deserts ever.”
Reviews.Author: Jpresskin
Reviews.Content: Great bar restaurant and their service has really stepped up compared to my last visit. Dinner is fine but do jot miss the vanilla creme cake with a whipped vanilla meringue frosting which is like nothing I have ever had. The bar scene is hip and they have an acrylic pool table to boot. Go for supper but better yet go for cocktails, dessert and an evening of intimate fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay-friendly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: JAS1663
Reviews.Content: Loved the intimacy of this hotel and the location is perfect to access Beverly Hills and West Hollywood. The decor is classically modern with a hip edge. Loved having Mr. C's restaurant downstairs. The housekeeping staff kept the room immaculate with 2 services per day. The valet and bellman were so friendly,professional and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay ! Excellent location and interiors but really poor concierge services !”
Reviews.Author: VedatM
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located. Very clean and renovated rooms. White and comfortable. The only negative point was the incapability of the ladies working in the concierge to assist us in any of our information requests.

Reviews.Title: “True Perfection”
Reviews.Author: naw5080
Reviews.Content: I dont know how anyone can give this hotel a negative review -- I travel to LA frequently and can honestly say Mr.C is one of the most fabulous hotels in LA. The decor is modern and classic, it is comfortable without being stuffy, and its immaculately clean. The entire staff will bend over backwards for you. The rooms are just right for being comfortable and cozy, you enter to a dressing area with closets and a dressing table which has the bathroom off to the right side and the bedroom directly in front. Each room has a private balcony with beautiful views from the higher floors (especially if you are facing the hills away from Pico). Upon entering the hotel you are greeted to a free bellini while the concierge shuffles your bags to your room. The bar is open and conversational, with additional indoor and outdoor seating areas to the side. The drink prices are high, but this is a 5-Star hotel in LA, so they are actually standard. The only con I can think of is that its a bit of a walk from the hip spots in LA, but there is a free shuttle service (in an Escalade) which we used frequently. And once you get your bearings, you can walk to several areas in about 10-15 minutes (including Rodeo Dr.). I never ate at the restaurant, but the entire hotel is simply fabulous. I dont think there is much better in LA or anywhere for that matter. I have turned my colleagues onto this hotel and they all love it too. For all of my travel to LA, Mr.C is my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service when Planning a Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Shannon P
Reviews.Content: Mr. C's staff was incredible when it came to giving a little surprise for our parents 35th wedding anniversary. Andrea was more than willing to assist us and everything went as planned. Typically at any other hotel there may have been a miscommunication along the way but not at Mr. C's, my husband and I hope to spend sometime to get away there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: flygal89
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our SECOND stay at Mr. C Beverly Hills, this time for a full week. My 8-yr-old daughter and I arrived at 10am on March 10, and because of the excellent service we received the last time we were there, I knew there would be no problem with arriving at the hotel early and asking them to store our bags till check-in. I was correct. Upon arrival, we were greeted at our cab by wonderful members of the valet staff...the most fabulous I have ever encountered. They took our bags to storage while we enjoyed Bellinis (a virgin Bellini for my daughter!) at the lobby bar (where the bartender was very personable) and got checked in. So far, so good! Both times we have stayed at the hotel, I have been absolutely amazed by the service of the valet/bell staff. They remember guests' names, and by the end of the stay, they felt like friends. Because we are from North Carolina, we were partial to Brandon, who quickly introduced himself to us as another North Carolinian...making everything seem more familiar. We were waiting for friends to arrive later in the day, but I wanted to get some shopping done on Robertson before their arrival, so I asked if the house car would be able to take us there. Not only did Art, the very warm and friendly driver, take us to Robertson; he told us to call him when we were ready to return. We shopped our favorite places on Robertson and had a late lunch at Newsroom Cafe before calling Art , who promptly picked us up and didn't seem to mind at all when we asked him to make a quick stop at Sprinkles Cupcakes on Santa Monica Blvd before returning to the hotel. Not only did he take us, but he circled the block while we got our cupcakes! Now, THAT'S service! Let me now tell you some important info about location. This hotel is located at the intersection of Beverwil and Pico, which places it JUST outside the Beverly Hills city limits, but it is the perfect location for anyone who wants to explore the city. Walking to the shopping/restaurants of Beverly Hills is several blocks, but easy for anyone in relatively good health, and it's a beautiful stroll! For those who cannot do it, the hotel car is available most of the time to take you anywhere within a three mile radius of the hotel. If you need to go a greater distance, the valet/bell staff is always happy to help you with a cab. We found them to be very prompt. Also, if you need to rent a car for a day or two, I'm sure the hotel can help you. We wanted to take the kids to Disneyland one day, so we just called the Enterprise location on La Cienega, and they were able to pick us up before our rental and drop us back at the hotel afterward. I would like to add that we used the hotel car a lot during our stay, and both Art and Angel, the drivers, were most courteous and friendly. We truly felt like we had made new friends with them before we left the hotel! As for the rooms at the hotel, they are quite comfortable. Every room has a balcony or even two, and we found the beds and pillows to be quite comfortable. We had no problems with noise from other guests, and we were thrilled to find a newspaper at our door every morning. The room we stayed in had only a shower and no tub, but that was not an issue for us. I'm not the person who takes a bath in a hotel, anyway. The soaps/shampoos the hotel provided were good and plentiful, and the towels were good too. The hairdryer in the room is better quality than the one I have at home, and there is an iron/ironing board if you need it. The bar in the room is fully stocked, as well. No complaints at all. I also must commend the housekeeping staff, who did an excellent job of keeping our room clean and neat while we were there. With two 8-yr-olds in the room, it wasn't always easy to keep it straight, but every evening when we returned, we found everything had been returned to order! Because we were on the go during this trip, we were unable to enjoy a meal in the hotel's restaurant. We did order room service one morning, and it was prompt and delicious. If you are a coffee drinker, you will not be disappointed. Just as when we left the hotel last July, we were sorry to leave. Almost everything about our stay was perfect, and we could not have been more pleased. Thank you, Mr. C staff, for another wonderful stay. We look forward to returning and would like to commend the following people on their excellent service: Brandon (valet/bell staff), Emily (lobby bar), Ben (bartender), Joshua Garman (a friendly member of the staff) and especially Art and Angel, who helped us navigate the city!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel to lounge and relax in after a long wedding day! Loved it! Gorgeous view in every room! Everyone must experience!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Barbiemom58
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a one week stay at the new Mr. C in Beverly Hills. The hotel is amazing in every way. It's like a bit of Europe in LA. These people DO know how to treat guests and run a beautiful and trendy hotel. The front desk is smart, helpful and professional, but at the same time, friendly. You are greeted in the valet area at your car and whisked away to the long, sleek marble bar in the lobby for a seat and a complimentary Bellini (this is a Cipriani hotel after all). While you sip, someone takes your credit card and checks you in. He then comes back to you (still sipping) with your room key. So relaxing and simple. The rooms are stunning. I was given a high-floor King with every amenity I could possibly need with a view that I am still talking about. On my small but big enough balcony I could see miles and miles into Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, Brentwood, Century City, and even to the Hollywood sign and Griffith Park and Observatory. Wow. The beds are fabulous. The sheets are crisp and luxurious. The decor was uncluttered and sleek - leather everywhere. Mirrors on every wall. No tubs, but huge showers with rain and hand-held heads. There was even a make-up vanity with a leather seat and mirror. Room Service was quick and they never got the order wrong (that's a first for most hotels) - in fact, twice they sent us (my college-aged kids were next door) extra nibbles. Nice. The lobby bar is handled by Emily, a true Southern Belle, who cannot do enough for anyone. The valets are a group of guys who greet you every single time they see you with a smile and a "Welcome back to Mr. C. How was your afternoon?" So polite. The concierge desk is manned by Kimberly, a beautiful and trendy British gal who knows just where everything is and is happening. She won't let you eat anywhere that isn't fabulous - she's got your back. The other concierge that I used was Solomon, a warm and smart gentleman who truly cares for his guests and treats them as if they were family in his home. When I had a problem with a restaurant, he told me that he wasn't going to send guests there anymore. He made me feel better about this restaurant and the shabby way that they treated my daughter, son and I. He then made sure that we enjoyed dessert in the lobby on him. Not necessary, but so thoughtful. There is a fitness center with many machines available 24/7. The magnificent rooftop is used only for private events, but any hotel guest can go up there to look around and enjoy the 360 degree breathtaking view. We only ate the restaurant food by the lovely, but small pool but it was excellent. Even the poolboys cannot do enough for you. When my daughter and son decided to move their chaises so to be in more direct sunlight, the poolboy insisted that they allow him to arrange the proper angle, new towels with headrests and a table between. Even my kids were impressed. The restaurant itself is beautiful. With a car, the location is great. Midway to everything. I would stay at this hotel again and again. No other hotel in LA could come close to the care, beauty, and professionalism of Mr. C. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “An Italian enclave in LA”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Nicely refurbished hotel in Beverly Hills run by the Cipriani family. The decor is italian-influenced (you can find everywhere photos of Italian actors of the 50s and 60s. Convenient location if you want to be close to Rodeo Drive. Nice view, if your rooms faces the hills. Good restaurant (Italian, what else?) but expensive. Rooms over the entrance hall can be noisy during the events. Overall, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service From Staff, Immaculately Clean”
Reviews.Author: Faz01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mr. C in October 2011 for 3 nights. The room was exactly as it is on their website photos. Lovely room which was spacious and very clean, nice leather sofas etc. This hotel gives a personal touch service to its guests, for example the manager himself welcomed us and showed us up to our room and drinks offered on arrival. The Concierge staff gave us an excellent service, booked our restaurants, taxis, and universal studio tour etc. The bed is turned down for you and the newspaper is always delivered in a little cotton bag hung on the door. Very polite courteous staff. On the down side there are no tea and coffee facilities in the room. Food and drink are typical five star prices, we had breakfast in the restaurant for two people which cost just over $50 - I think it was $7 for a cup of coffee (small). In the morning the hotel do put out some complimentary coffee which you could go down and get to bring back to your room but we only found out about this on the last day. In terms of location this hotel is in a residential area and NOT near any tourist type of places if that is what you want to do - i.e. hollywood/sunset boulevard/universal studios/Downtown LA etc. Rodeo Drive is about 15/20 minute walk but the hotel really is located in a residential area - so be warned as taxi fares can start adding up - there is a house car which takes you within 3 miles of the hotel but this is not always available. We ate at STK in West Hollywood - food lovely, typical five star prices. We also had dinner at the Beverly Wilshire hotel and got a window seat looking onto Rodeo Drive. I was extremely disappointed with the food - I think they just re-heated the mash potato the food was very, very average and not of a high standard. We went to downtown LA and ate at the nickel diner - I had an avocado dish, it was delicious and soooooooo cheap. We didn't feel very safe in downtown LA probably because we have never been before and ventured down some dodgy blocks, needless to say we swiftly turned back. Also went to Universal Studios for the first time and thought it was brilliant. Overall lovely, clean hotel with very polite courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice restyled boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaurenBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Well redesigned hotel with great service, nice rooms, and a enjoyable restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, sleekly designed hotel in a good location with very helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: diane100
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at my recent stay with my 14 year old daughter for her President's week vacation. I booked it through Magellan vacations a few months prior and actually had a rate DROP since my initial booking to $250 per night for a city facing double on the third floor. This was an amazing value. The beds were incredibly comfortable, likened to Marriott bed quality. The decor was chic modern. The room had a flat screen TV and a small but beautiful bathroom with rain shower head and hand spray. Very beautifully designed. I will say that I found it odd that there was absolutely NO drawer space? Yes a closet but no drawer space. That would be my only criticism. Otherwise the hotel was wonderful, and the concierge Kimberly literally planned and booked this entire trip from restaurants to tickets to cirque de soleil, To surf lessons for my daughter, and the itinerary for touring Malibu and Santa Monica as well as The Paramount Studio tour and universal studios tour as well as arranging a rental car. She was excellent and booked most of this before my arrival. I am very grateful for her help as I could not have done it myself. We have great memories of the trip. And thanks to Kimberly we really made the most of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazingmuppet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon after returning from Hawaii and we definately saved the best til last! The free bellinis on arrival certainly put us in a good mood as did the welcome we received when we checked in. The rooms are comfy and look fantastic and it is definately worth booking a room with a Beverly hills view. The location is pretty handy for rodeo drive, we walked there in about 15 minutes through a pretty safe neighbourhood. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: The number one thing that stuck out at me was the amazing service from every single person who worked at the hotel. From the bar tender, to valet, to front desk, they all were on top of their game. I have to say the valet is one of the best I have experienced in town. They were by far the quickest at bringing my car up than any other hotel in the area. The rooms were nice, nothing amazing but still very nice. The bed was very comfortable, got a good nights sleep every night. The bathroom was good, with a rainfall shower and 2 sinks. There was no bathtub, just a walk in shower. The one thing I did not like was the hardwood floors in the room. You could hear the people above and beside you whenever they walked. It wasn't a huge deal but that would be the only negative about the stay. A few other random things...The location was great with easy access. There is a grocery store and starbucks across the street so you have everything you need within walking distance. Parking is $35 per day but that is about normal for any hotel in Beverly Hills. The complimentary wifi was a nice bonus though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KAOSMUA
Reviews.Content: Great stay, amazing service, The room that was assigned to us wasn't ready upon arrival (we arrived late morning), so Richard found us another room immediately. Merci Richard, et bonne continuation! The service was always good, when ordering room service, or just calling a cab, offering us water for the road. Coffee was very expensive (7$ for a small cup of cappuccino that wasn't that great), so we walked down the road for breakfast the next day. I would recommand this hotel anytime! The room was big, comfortable, we were near the elevator but didn't hear a thing! Great balcony.

Reviews.Title: “They brought the restaurant to our room”
Reviews.Author: PurdieParks
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel late and after 24 hours of travelling were too tired to get dressed up and head to the restaurant. So we showered and then ordered room service. It was amazing, when it arrived two waiters brought this large round table into our room, with the heated trolley under the crisp white table-cloth. They served us dinner the way they would in the restaurant (having been to the London branch many times). It was funny for us, sitting there in a bath-robes, perching on the end of the bed, eating this 'posh' meal! We slept so well and woke up early the next morning to see the sunrise over LA. We took the lift to the top floor and went out on the balcony. It was beautiful. We had to depart early the next morning, but I was keen to see the pool, it hadn't been opened yet, but the staff where happy to open it up early for us to have a look. I really enjoyed our short stay there and hope to return again for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as good”
Reviews.Author: CoronadoCarol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mr. C in October, and gave it 5 stars despite some oddities; the overall ambiance and service made up for those oddities. Although our January visit had fewer oddities, the service and ambiance were not quite as European. Instead of immediately offering the on-arrival complimentary bellini, the greeter offered us tea or coffee; only when we looked baffled did he offer the bellini. Mr C is a European style hotel, with the pros and cons associated with this. Cons: very high prices for such things as drinks and coffee; showers but no tubs; no icemakers--it is necessary to call room service; no in-room coffee makers.Pros: the aforementioned ambiance and service; newspapers delivered on the door handle in little cloth bags. The rooms at Mr C are spacious and lovely, furnished in either white or brown leather (I prefer the white). On our first stay I asked for a quiet room far from the elevator, and I got a noisy room right near the elevator with several other sources of noise--the outside entrance below, the moving of furniture above, and the people next door. This time I got a room that, although still next to the elevator, was quiet. Again, except for the people above--we could hear them pee, flush, and walk around. The stylish wood floors in the rooms are not insulated enough against upstairs noise. We ate at the restaurant both times. The first time we were very impressed with both the food and the drink, although they tried (as always seems to happen to me) to seat us right next to the service station. This time they succeeded in seating us right next to the service station; when I complained about the rattling of cutlery and asked to move, the waiter (who was very pleasant) assured us the noise would stop. It didn't, nor did the constant movement of people back and forth around and behind us. There was no need to seat us in this spot, the restaurant was about one third full. We had several dishes ranging from exellent (the proscuttio cotta with mozarella) to Chef Boy-Ar-Dee (the pasta with red sauce and sausage; I would stay away from anything with red sauce in Mr. C). The white cake and sorbets were awesome. The glasses of wine were ridiculously small, and thus incredibly overpriced. Also overpriced: the parking, at $35 a day. If I could only rid myself of my travel jinxes, which follow me absolutely everywhere I go: being seated at the table next to the service station, and being assigned a room next to the elevator and ice maker (that is, in hotels that have an icemaker). Although Mr. C says it is in Beverly Hills, it is not, it is adjacent. There is a handy Ralph's across the road, but not much else. The shops and boutiques of Rodeo Drive are quite a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “So good, I would move to Mr. C's permanently!”
Reviews.Author: Ultraplur
Reviews.Content: Staying at Mr. C's was a very refreshng reminder of what impeccable execution and attention to detail can do. I selected Mr. C's at the recommendation of a friend, who is a regular n the Beverly Hills area. After looking a the past reviews and the hotel's website I decided to book a premium Beverly Hills view room on a high floor. Before arriving, I received an email from the hotel's concierge, offering assistance with airport transportation and other arrival details. I have to say that the concierges at Mr. C's are among the best I've ever interacted with. Not only are they very corteous and professional, but they are well connected, experienced and effective. They fond the perfect solutions every time, from renting a Fiat 500 to getting me on the guest list of a popular night spot. A big recognition to Solomon in the concierge desk! The valets and doormen are equally effective and very elegantly appointed in non-ostentatious but classic Barbour jackets. The hotel lobby takes you straight into the main bar, where I was treated to fantastic bellinis. So good that I went up to my room after 45 minutes of arriving! The bar and lobby scene is relaxed, refined and dressed up in an Italian/bauhaus design mix, with the friendliest bar servers that you can imagine. There is an outdoors terrace on the bar, which is perfect for an ever more intimate experience. The hotel's reception is cleverly hidden behind the bar, so that at no moment do yo feel in a hotel. I always felt as if arriving to a friend's apartment. Very cozy and welcoming! I used the hotel's gym several times and it is very well equipped with cardio and weights although it is on the smaller side and I could see it crowding up on peak seasons. The hotel's pool is next to the restaurant! which makes the entrance a bit intimidatng at lunch time, however, it is ver cutely arranged and I would really like to come back in the summer heat to dip in and enjoy more bellinis there. My room had a striking view to Beverly Hills and Hollywood. I slept with the drapes open as it was impossible not to fall in love with the sight. Very quiet day and night, although I can imagine that rooms facing the city side on West Pico Ave. must be noisier. The rooms are all very elegantly decorated in a matching blend of French riviera, sea-side villa and Italian country side. You experience wood, leather, pastels and rich fabrics. Very complete mini-bar (including intimacy and healing kits!), iPod compatible stereo, flat screen on-demand TV with movies and very fast and free wi-fi everywhere. My room had a small terrace that I used for breakfast and after work drinks. Fantastic!! I could live here!! The restaurant was the best part of my stay. Although not as popular as I would have expected for a Cipriani property, the service, quality and value are truly remarkable. I felt as if dining in a high end place in Rome. Truly, something else! from the proseco to the slow roasted chicken, I very much enjoyed breakfast, lunch and dinner at Mr. C. All in all, Mr. C's is an excellent representation of a luxury boutique hotel. It is discreet, elegant and powerful. Just what I like! I will surely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hoteliers should stay here and take notes!”
Reviews.Author: LRWanderlust
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. Welcoming staff, immacutely clean room, beautiful, comfortable, great location, great view, great food. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Shocker”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: Once we got there the TV was not working. So we had to swap room and that seems very difficult for the hotel. The Bell boys and the drivers was very good. But When ever we asked for something it took them a while to take bring it. But the worst problem was that there room was very dusty meaning that the room was very dirty we found this out as we kept sneezing and once we moved to the Bellagio the sneezing stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another reason to Love Boutique Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: jaxmarquez
Reviews.Content: I had to be there for business and it was rainy but I definitely did not mind staying in my room. It was large, modern, clean & very comfortable. Felt like my own small flat, not a hotel. Also had a nice balcony. When I first walked in the fresh air & smell of rain was coming in the opened balcony doors and there was classical music playing..very dramatic & very awesome!! Room service was good, they also offer car service. I had to run to the Grove which was only a few minutes away and instead of a town car I had a nice sleek black Mercedes. Classy Move Mr. C's!

Reviews.Title: “CIPRIANI is ready to open more MR C”
Reviews.Author: Travelerwell
Reviews.Content: Finally an hotel with chic and european elegance from the moment i was greeted by the valet thru my entire stay . This is the real deal , impeccable personal service, fantastic north of italy cuisine with the CIPRIANI freshest ingredients.Great crowd. Very knowleagable and helpful concierge and front desk. The room are decorated with pure italian taste, leather, leather and leather, marble bathroom and breathtaking view of LA from our balcony, very refined and confortable bed. but what made the best of my stay was the people, truly Cipriani style !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location but some things expensive”
Reviews.Author: LouiseandIan
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel and found that Expedia had not passed on the details of our reservation properly to the hotel so we found ourselves with the wrong type if room so be careful of booking with Expedia. Having said that the hotel did everything to out it right. The hotel is a great place to explore la however food and drinks and parking are too expensive, more even than the Mondrian which spoilt an otherwise great time. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning rooms, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Dora C
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully furnished and are exactly as they look in the pictures. The staff were super friendly... we arrived early and they were able to accomodate us and even upgraded the room. Its about a 5min walk to the strip of shops and restaurants in Beverley Hills. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and the wait staff was wonderful and the breakfast spread I ordered was incredible (but pricey). Our only complaints were the lack of service elevators (causing long waits and frequent stops) and the tapping from the wind blowing on the patio doors (which we thought was our neighbour walking around, until we realized the real source of the noise right before checking out!). Also, we ordered a room service Margherita pizza and it was expensive, small and not very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: JordanScott
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to come up with a reason to return to LA just so I can stay at Mr. C again. The rooms are large, chic, sunny with excellent views. The staff is very helpful and friendly. You won't find a chicer hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Worst restaurant ever - avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: Jpresskin
Reviews.Content: This new boutique hotel is the location is where the new Mr. C restaurant has opened and should close immediately. DO not confuse this place with it's New York counterpart (which is good) This pretentious Italian restaurant serves lousy food and is an insult. The fish tasted likes Swanson and the rolls and salads were not edible. The tables and chairs are built for small children. There is not enough elbow room to move without knocking over drinks and dinner plates on one another. Management was used to this happening and simply put a dry table cloth on wet tables. Bad food and a very uncomfortable night. The meal was $375.00 with 2 cocktails and one deserts. Immediately after leaving we got burgers and fries because we were starving and all very upset about the experience and the treatment. I left my card with the manager as we left and asked that someone contact me the next day for an explanation. - No one called. I have called two times since and no one will return my call

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Axs1559
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Outstanding staff. The service is the best I have ever experienced in any hotel, anywhere in the world. Particularly housekeeping and concierge. Bar staff offered me suggestions on what to see in LA in my spare time. Completely refurbished June 11 and is immaculate and furnished to a very high standard throughout. The West Pico boulevard runs next hotel (and the outdoor pool is on this side) so there is some traffic noise, but this is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmmgem14
Reviews.Content: What a great hidden gem. I love this hotel. The service, the food the decor!! Its all there. I can't wait to go back. BTW Solomon was so amazing, great concierge, he gave us all the scoop on where to shop and see the stars!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Meme023
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful you can't beat the location Really close to rodeo drive but in an quiet neighborhood in Beverly hills Everybody is very professional and nice - great concierge ( Salomon ) Would stay again !

Reviews.Title: “Charming, first class service with Beverly Hills luxe”
Reviews.Author: Tbinozz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mr C in the last week first for 4 nights then another night at the end of the week. The hotel is superb and immaculate. We were looking for a boutique hotel and something with more personal service. We couldn't have been more pleased. On arrival into the smart grounds we were immeidately greeted and invited in to the hotel lobby which is actually like steping into a bar / lounge. No waiting in line, no filling out forms, We were offered a cocktail, a very comfy seat in a leather lounge and a relax while the hotel staff sorted out our room. The room itself was well appointed, modern with a touch of the old Hollywood and very comfy. Beds are gorgeous (e hd a twin room). We opted for the Beverly HIlls view which for us was well worth it. Good views, greenry and it really felt we were away from the bustle of LA. What really makes this hotel though is the service. The conceirge is fantastic - great recommendations, friendly and approachable. There is also a free car servie within 3 miles of the hotel which was fantastic. Frances our driver has been in the business for years and was a real pleasure to deal with. What's clear about Mr C is that the hotel cares about its customers and its staff. It is building a brand, uncoupled from an impersonal chain, and that is exactly what I love about it. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in LA.

Reviews.Title: “serious hotel room design flaws”
Reviews.Author: ywgtravellers
Reviews.Content: I just want to preface this review with the fact that we are regular travellers and only stay in 4 or 5 star hotels around the world. We typically travel every month and usually stay in hotels like the Four Seasons and luxury boutique hotels. The opening of Mr. C Beverly Hills intrigued us and we therefore booked ourselves a weekend away. Check-in was quick and easy (with a complimentary ‘Bellini’ in the bar) however, it took quite some time for the bell boy to bring up the luggage even though the hotel appeared to be not very busy. Several other guests spoke of a similar experience over the weekend. The rooms are decorated very nicely and come with complimentary Wi-Fi and bottled water. Our only concern was the noise level. We requested and were given one of the quieter rooms (facing the hills) which was quiet with respect to street noise. Design details of the hotel however resulted in the room being quite noisy. Rooms are fitted with hard wood floors that echo footsteps from above. It seemed to never end. We heard kids jumping and running around and the clicking of shoes throughout our stay. Voices, TV noise, and music reverberated through the walls. In addition, guest room doors are large and the sound of slamming doors can be heard up and down the hallways day and night. We ended up stuffing towels under our door (as the gap is quite large) but this did not insulate us from the almost constant noise. On the second night of our stay there was an engagement party in the 12th floor banquet room that had a DJ playing music until 3am. The music could be heard all the way down to our 9th floor room. Management were quick to apologize and ended up not charging us for one night and agreed to move us to a quieter room. The second room ended up being no quieter. By far the best part of our stay was the restaurant. Staff were friendly and attentive. Although we were usually the only couple having breakfast, the place was jammed at dinner. The food and service was fantastic but again the noise level was uncomfortably loud; more like a sports bar. Clearly the place is full of locals at night and on the weekend as everyone seemed to know each other. In the end it was a good stay, however next time we’ll be back at the Four Seasons or L’Ermitage. By the way, Mr. Jagger (the manager) and Mr. Cipriani (the owner) were in town and were around all weekend. Mr. Cipriani held court in the restaurant each evening. I mentioned to the front desk that we’d like to meet with either one to give them some feedback, as I’m on the Navigator Panel with Conde Nast Magazine, but they did not bother to connect with us.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, quirky boutique with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: tuckie
Reviews.Content: It's rare that you stay at a hotel that you actually feel happy to come back to after a long day....but Mr. C fits the bill. It's mostly about the extraordinarily warm service, but it's also the small scale of the hotel. Excellent service comes in many forms. I usually stay at the Peninsula when I'm in LA and their service is certainly excellent as well, but it's different at Mr. C. At the Peninsula or the Four Seasons the service is discreet, professional, efficient....all of the superlatives you would expect but it can also be a bit cold and distant. Now don't get me wrong, I usually appreciate this....I'm not staying there to make friends....but at Mr. C it's quite different. The staff somehow makes you feel genuinely welcome and part of their small community without seeming artificial or obsequious. The small scale of the hotel adds to the feeling of intimacy. The public spaces and the rooms are quite small but are beautifully appointed and met all of my needs. The term boutique hotel is bandied about quite a bit nowadays but Mr. C really is a boutique....a small, bespoke gem that is a great contrast to the larger, more corporate hotels in LA. Mind you, that may not be for everybody. Many business travelers will complain about the lack of an in-room coffee maker and many leisure travelers will complain about the lack of a bathtub. And everyone will probably dislike the location....it's off the beaten path and is on a busy street. But I loved it, quirks and all...for it's personality, it's style and for the very fact that it offers a different experience from other top hotels in LA. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: 1995sb21
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and each time has been absolutely flawless. I LOVE the fact that the rooms have wood flooring as opposed to dirty carpet. Very clean, comfortable and well appointed rooms. Love the trunk style furniture. Have not had any issues with traffic noise. The fact that you can text to have your car brought up is basically genius in my book. When you check in it feels like they know you. The restaurant serves some of the best Italian food I have every had. Thank you Mr C for coming to the LA area! This is our go to whenever we have to be in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: rogerad
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to LA on business for two nights. To our surprise, we felt like we'd taken a vacation to Venice or Rome. The moment you step off your car, the service, style and vibe of this place is European. Extraordinary care and attention is given to you. We will definitely come back. I had several meetings, but kept wanting to come back and hang out at the restaurant and bar. Every staff member is extremely conscientious. I showed up dressed like a slob - and they still treated me like a king. We went back to our room late at night and had problems opening the door to our suite. While maintenance took care of the problems they comped our drinks at the restaurant. They obsessed on all the details - and you feel amazing staying in this place. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Emma S
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous trip to Mr. C. The staff were wonderful, very helpful at all times. Check in with a Bellini, house car to use within a 3 mile radius and late check out, they did everything to help us!! Loved the glass pool table, very unique! Great views of the hills and the 'Hollywood sign' from our balcony. The rooms were gorgeous. This is very good value for money staying in a lovely part of town. Choy (spelling?) was extremely helpful. We will be recommending this hotel and will be back for sure! The restaurant is very good also! When they did not have what I wanted it was no problem, they made it for me. Go to Mr. C., it's a hidden Gem!! Xxx

Reviews.Title: “LA Chic in Beverley Hills!”
Reviews.Author: SimonLiebel
Reviews.Content: Finally Cipriani comes to LA in full force. This hotel is uber cool. Instead of the boring reception check in you sit down at the bar, order the classic Bellini and wait for all the work to be done for you. The restaurant has all the classic Cipriani favourites and the staff as expected are impeccable, friendly and attentive. You might spot one of the Cipriani family descreetly ensuring the guest experience is nothing short of perfect! IF you are young, hip, cool and want to be seen in the place to be seen! Mr C Beverley Hills is the place to be!!!

Reviews.Title: “stylish - but ...”
Reviews.Author: happa00
Reviews.Content: Arrival is very pleasent and welcoming - Rooms have a special layout with a mini closet ( wie had a Studio Suite ) - Balcony is fine, but blv traffic 24/7 - Swimmingpool is a joke - Restaurant is decent but Way overpriced - ASK for rooms located 7th Floor and up - go for a king bed - queen is tiny - skip breakfast and stop by starbux ( 35$ will buy you a lot at SBX

Reviews.Title: “Good - but missing something”
Reviews.Author: neilg23
Reviews.Content: Ok , the good. The room was lovely and well finished with quality furnishings. The staff were all very friendly & helpful, so well done team. The pool area and pool service very nice. On the downside - we were on the 10th floor in a suite with a lovely balcony the, street noise is noticible, however don't worry too much as with the doors closed there is no real problem and rememeber you are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, however very noisy due to poor windows”
Reviews.Author: Midouille
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nicely decorated, the service is impeccable, and the location is very good. However, we had a room on Picco Boulevard, and the floor-to-ceiling windows are very inefficient in terms of noise-proofness. We have spent the two nights with earplugs as we felt we were sleeping on the boulevard. I suppose if you take a room facing Beverly Hills, this is not as much an issue - this would be my recommendation if you want to fully enjoy the nice hotel and beautiful new furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class in Every Department”
Reviews.Author: Rabconn64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mr C's for two nights during our trip to California in early September. The hotel can only be described as Top Notch!! Nothng was any problem to the immaculate staff team and the Scots bartender was a wealth of information. Ths is the finest hotel I have ever stayed in, the rooms are superb and the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aesmith3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on a business trip this summer, and it was fantastic! Service was awesome, location is great, and the rooms are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel? - 5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Nico
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service at this hotel. Rooms are clean and spacious, but the bathrooms lack ventilation. Downside? Noisy and lack of soundproof doors. That is a problem that shouldn't exist at a 5 star hotel. Wifi system is also so slow and unstable. Need to be upgraded to fit a hotel at this level. Location is really good, but the pool is microscopic for a hotel that has 5 stars. Restaurant is good but overpriced. Will be back if I get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful albeit slightly out of town”
Reviews.Author: jckelly09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room with views of Beverley Hills. The staff were excellent from start to finish, welcoming,warm, professional and friendly. On arrival we received a delicious complimentary Belini and everything was taken care of. The rooms were fantastic, large, bright and very well furnished with quality Italian products throughout. Some members have raised the food as an issue but we thought it was well presented and tasty with excellent staff, both for breakfast and dinner. We will return asap! Thanks for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “great service, great experience”
Reviews.Author: baros2010
Reviews.Content: I lived many great hotels. I have to say that the experience of living in Mr. C Beverly HIlls is the best. I checked in the hotel tonight. When I drived the car to the entrence. The waiter asked my last name. He quickly knew my reservation and arranged everything. A handson boy accompanied us to a bar to ask something to drink. Then he helped me to check in. I even did not know where the frontdesk is. I lived in 8 floor.yu8i-o90.p/;_When I entered the room. There is a box candy and a card for me. The room is with music. The view of room is so great. You can see the whole view of the hill. great service and great experience. Haining

Reviews.Title: “Great entarance, shame about the 'house car service'”
Reviews.Author: newlydiate
Reviews.Content: On pulling into the driveway for our 4 night stay at Mr C, 3 members of staff walked towards us, to open the car door, take the luggage and to send our name through to reception to get us checked in, wow. We were offered a couple of belini's and sat outside the front entrance to drink them, while our luggage was taken to our room & we were checked in, without us having to go to the front desk, this is the life! Reception came out to us with our key & to tell us our room number & floor. We walked into our 8th floor room with a 'Beverly Hills' view & were like, wow! beautiful modern room, which looked a lot bigger than on the website, fab view, Hollywood Hills, and we could even see the Hollywood sign, well worth the extra money. Nice but small bathroom, 2 closets. But no coffee maker. We tried to get on line with our laptop but couldn't, they were having some problems, so no internet which we were relying on, being from the UK, we were using Google maps a lot. Next day after walking to a nearby Coffee Bean for our morning coffee, we tried to get on line again, but nothing. That evening still no internet even though AT&T had been in to install fibre optic internet. The hotel did let us use their laptop though for the remainder of our stay, because we just could not get on line with ours. Pool area was lovely as were the staff bringing us complimentary water. The only problem at the pool was the noise from the traffic on Pico Blvd. The hotel may be on a quiet residential street but it also backs onto a main road. We arranged for a taxi to take us to Rodeo Drive one evening for dinner, after waiting 15 or so minutes we were informed that the hotel house car would take us ( we didn't know about this service) to save us from waiting for our cab. On dropping us off the driver informed us that he would come back and collect us, if we rang him before 9pm. We got the restaurant to call him at 8.40pm & we were told he was on his way. At 9.15pm he still hadn't showed up, even though we were only 10 mins away. The restaurant called us a cab to get us back to the hotel were we complained at the front desk, they couldn't apologise enough & said they would look into it. The next day they informed us that they were still looking into the situation and would be in touch with us by noon that day. We checked out the following day with no still explaination as to what happened.(Not very proffesional) Apart from no internet, & no in room coffee (who wants to get dressed and walk around the block for coffee) I personally want to sit out on the balcony in my robe and enjoy a coffee before facing the day, And the house car incident, our stay at Mr C was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Mr C for a few days on the first part of our honeymoon. We had previously stayed when the property was known as The Tower and thoroughly enjoyed that stay. From the moment we pulled into the driveway it was clear what the vision for the hotel was - Not only is the property itself beautiful but the warmth of hospitality shone through in abundance. Complimentary cocktails at check in and complimentary Champagne for the honeymooners certainly were an unexpected but welcome suprise! Nothing was too much trouble for anyone. We were personally shown to our room - not something i have experienced before even in luxury brand hotels - and when the door opened we were truly stunned at the quality of the room and the amenities. I'm not normally one for writing reviews but felt that we had such exceptional service, in such a beatiful hotel, that it was more than worthy of my time to write this. We have stayed in luxury hotels across the globe and this is currently number 1 on our list of places to stay. Without doubt this is the only place we will be staying in LA in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ConcernedCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the room looked very nice, but the bathroom was small (with a good shower). The room was not quiet. The room had simulated (or maybe real) hardwood floors with thin rugs. This did not absorb sounds, but was reflective. The doors to the hallway had nice, solid secure locking systems, but were very noisy when the doors were closed. The noise would ricochet down the hallway and was heard several rooms away from the offending door. It was like having the door to your room slammed very loudly (the vibrations could be felt). GREAT PLACE IF YOU ENJOY NOISE!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: hollingster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long Labor Day weekend stay at Mr. C. As others have mentioned, the hotel is very new, opening earlier this summer. We were upgraded to a beverly hills view, which was a nice surprise. The room was very clean, large and beautiful, and we enjoyed drinking our coffee and reading the complimentary newspaper on the spacious balcony each morning. The location was very good; it was quiet, yet within a 10 minute walk up the street, there were a number of places to grap coffee and lunch/breakfast if you wanted something other than the very conveniently located Coffee Bean on the next corner from the hotel. Rodeo Drive was only a bit further of a walk. Freeway access was also very convenient. We didn't use the pool area much, but it was lovely, spacious and private. The workout facility was well equipped; the only negative being that is located in the basement with no windows to sunny outside; but it is more than sufficient to get a good indoor workout. The staff -all of them - were extremely friendly and went out of their way to ensure that we had a wondeful stay. The service was personal while granting us our privacy. This is a true 5 star hotel with matching 5 star service. We definitely would recommend this hotel and stay again at it next time we return to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in LA Area”
Reviews.Author: DarkDreamer2011
Reviews.Content: They just opened and had an amazing rate for a 5* hotel. Service was great, hotel design very stylish. No nickel and diming on internet, parking. Excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent very sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan P
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only been open a few months but every thing about it is excellent We had a room over looking the the Hollywood hills and the views were great the room it self was bright and modern and a pleasure to stay in The staff were the best I have ever come across and could not do enough for you I would not hesitate to recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HAeBA
Reviews.Content: Although remodelling construction of part of hotel was still on-going the room was impeccably furnished and the staff was very professional and friendly. Main down side of the construction was lack of facilities; lobby, reception and restaurant but we believe that now when it is probably done it must be looking amazing. Definitely would recommend it. One thing to keep in mind is that Beverly Hills in general does not appear to offer many options for evening leisure, since this hotel is well inside Beverly Hills it means that you need a mean of transportation to seek for a greater variety of bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelaround2009
Reviews.Content: Our quick stay in this hotel was great. Upon arrival, the valet greeted us then took our car, got our room keys, and offered us complimentary bellinis without our ever needing to go to the front desk. Perfect! They also offer complimentary wireless and car service within 3mi of the hotel. It's JUST outside of Beverly Hills, but it's an easy mile walk from the heart of Rodeo and fabulous restaurants. The rooms were new and modern. All around, thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “extremely nice place with a european flair”
Reviews.Author: cakamom
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect with this hotel because it 'used' to be a Holiday inn. Well, let me say there are NO traces to a chain hotel in this revamped, trendy and chic hotel stop in Beverly Hills. The staff was wonderful. The complimentary bellini was tasty. The room was nice. I'll definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, excellent place and view!”
Reviews.Author: mirsini80
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, in a very good location near Rodeo Drive. From the 13th floor (which the breakfast is served you can see the hollywood sign and from the top the beverly hills). it's near Hollywood by car and also near to Shopping malls. The room is very good, has enough space, big balkony's and it is very clean. I have visited LA twice and both times i have stayed in the same hotel. Value for money location and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Having just opened in June - they were trying very hard to please us.”
Reviews.Author: blaroo12
Reviews.Content: We tried the new Mr. C in Beverly HIlls and were greeted with a lovely valet when we drove up. However, the front desk really needs some more training. We had to wait for our room to be ready at 5:00 pm!!! That was an alarm raiser. Why would we have to wait at that hour? Really weird. Our room was very nice but here is the BIG QUESTION?? WHY WOULD ANYONE PUT WHITE LEATHER COVERING OVER A DRESSER AND BED TABLES? This is a disaster waiting to happen. Forget having red wine by your bedside. Also, the poor housekeeper finally made it to our room to clean around 5:00pm the next day which totally explained why we had to wait the preceding to day to get into our room. She explained she is the only one working the entire floor. Whew! Other than the above, the hotel is nicely appointed - white leather aside - and they just opened. Sooooo, let's hope they can smooth out those rough edges. I would return just to see that but I would definitely ask for a room on the NORTH side so as not to be on the Pico side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Most Amazing Experience. MUST STAY"”
Reviews.Author: ashleyin702
Reviews.Content: My name is Ashley Ross :) And we stayed @ Mr. C Hotel on the 26th of July for one night and I have already booked to come back in a week (8/20) I just want to start out by saying this hotel is definitely 5 STAR! My bf and I stayed here in hopes to find our future home in LA. From the moment I got out of the car I felt extremely welcomed. I have never felt as great as I did walking into the hotel. The Valet/ Doormen escorted us into the Hotel and straight to the bar for a complimentary Bellini The wonderful lady who checked us in was so gracious and genuine. We were told we were getting an uprade to the Studio. We were ecstatic and didn't know what to expect. We ran for the elevator in excitement and found out our room had not one, but two patios. It was an absolutely gorgeous room. We were entranced. I even jumped on the bed. Our bellman was great. He was very genuine and gracious as well. As well as very relatable and we had a good conversation with him. Following that, we went down to check out the pool. We were amazed with the pool. It was beautiful and the perfect size. The server by the pool came by for drinks, but we still had our bellini so we were set. :) After the pool, we went to check out the gym. OH MY GOD! The gym is beautiful. There was no one in there but us so it was like our own personal space. If you need water or ear phones they are provided. The equiment is very state of the art and the latest and greatest. After we were headed to get ready for the evening out in the beautiful restroom. We did not eat at the restaurant but headed for happy hour across the street at the sushi restaurant. ( WHICH YOU MUST TRY! ) We went out that night and came home to the most amazing bed I've ever slept in. I recoomend this hotel for COUPLES or FAMILIES just trying to escape the hustle and bustle of LA. I work at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Las Vegas so I am used to providing 5 star service. This hotel definitely gave us that service. I am very appreciative to the staff and have been recommending this hotel to EVERYONE I can. :) Thank you Mr.C for welcoming us to our new home and not even realizing the impact you've made.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Shihtzufan
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for four nights. The good things were the comfortable beds and newly decorated rooms. However, several little things were wrong and I do not think the management are really on top of things. Twice when I ordered a continental breakfast from room service it was delivered with no plate or cutlery, and no butter or jams to go with it. It was brought when I pointed it out, but this really shouldnot happen. On the second day of my visit two strange people opened the door, saying that they had just checked in and had been given that same room number! This too should never happen. They say they have turndown service, but on two n ights out of the four it was not done. I did not like the layout of the hotel as the bar and restaurant both open on to the forecourt where the cars are arriving. And in fact the bar was always empty as it is totally lacking in atmosphere and it is not inviting in any way. In order to get to the swimming pool (which did not open until 11 a.m) you have to walk out of the main entrance, past all the cars and in through a side gate. I too had a problem with the door lock, and also with the hot water in the shower, which was difficult to get! All in all I would say things are going to have to improve a lot if Mr C wants to compete in the luxury sector. There are far better hotels in Beverley Hills than this.

Reviews.Title: “Unprepared to open”
Reviews.Author: Grazie1768
Reviews.Content: We have changed three rooms in three days. We did not get the two dbl beds requested. One of us had to sleep on an uncomfortable roll away. Our keys could not work, the "engineer is unable to fix it". The next day we were sent to another room with a rollaway. The three of us slept in a king bed. Tonight i checked in for the third time into a dbl bed room. Where's my luggage, i don't know. The staff has no idea what they are doing. There's no one over 30 working here. They're playing games on their phone and oh the concierge is gone for this evening. Mr. C needs to come personally and get a seasoned staff for any hope of this hotel to last.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Service, Experience & Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: nalts
Reviews.Content: With one night in LA, my wife and I wanted to splurge but avoid the stuffy arrogance of many high-end hotels. As we pulled into the recently-renovated Mr. C we were asked our last name and the concierge new our first name. The manager on duty met us with an incredibly warm smile, and invited us to the Cipriani bar, where we enjoyed a complementary drink that the friendly bartender said was a Northern Italian creation of the family (Cipriani). We then leisurely entered our room on the 11th floor overlooking Beverly Hills and the Hollywood sign. The room is spacious, pristine and newly renovated. 20 minutes ago I was grumpy from LA traffic, and now sit on the balcony knowing that the next 24 hours hold an experience I'll not soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mrbyrnes57
Reviews.Content: In the last year I have stayed at several 5 star properties in Nantucket, Cabo, St. Barts, etc. Mr C was right with all of them. Wonderful property with a very helpful and friendly staff. The rooms were great and the atmosphere was even better. Will definitely return to Mr C.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missymomm
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in the U.S. The service is the shining star of this hotel. Of course the food is fabulous and the rooms superbly appointed. The location is tucked away in a quiet area but close to wherever you need to be in Beverly Hills. A wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Return As Quickly As Possible”
Reviews.Author: MrsShields
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and the staff was so friendly and kind. Not only were they attentive, but so courteous. We went for our honeymoon for initially 3 nights, but we had such a lovely time, we extended our stay. Everyone introduced themselves and went out of their way for anything we requested. They were knowledgable about the area, and made great suggestions for eateries and entertainment. Our bellman's name was Angel, the house drivers were Angel and Francis, and the first person that greeted us was Jessica. I was even greeted with a Bellini upon check in. This place was so awesome and luxurious. I loved feeling spoiled every minute here.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty and unkind”
Reviews.Author: buncomamma
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel! I was left waiting for my room to be made up on check in for five hours. No offer of a cold drink or anything! I had to go to the grocery store to use the bathroom! I was questioned twice by snooty staff as to why I was waiting in the lobby. I had to ask for my bags to be brought from their storage so I could take medication and had not offer of a private area to open my bags and had to take my meds in front of other guests. I complained and was given an apology by Danielle, who was very nice. Then we were charged for mini bar items that we never had! No price list for mini bar the items was posted so we went to Ralphs store to purchase snacks. My first review was not posted!

Reviews.Title: “Can hardly wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: flygal89
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter and a friend to LA, and we stayed at Mr. C Beverly Hills. We were impressed BEFORE we arrived! Giselle, who works the front desk, had been most helpful answering questions for us over the phone, so we could hardly wait to get there! Upon arrival, we were greeted by name! Happy, smiling faces converged upon our taxi to help us get inside, and Jessica showed us to the bar, where we were delighted with complimentary Bellinis! We enjoyed our Bellinis while Jessica got us checked in, and we were then shown to our room. The room was very comfortable without being "overdone". The bedding was crazy comfortable, and the staff provided a foam pillow for one of us who is allergic to down pillows. The bar was fully stocked. The safe was easy to operate, and the balconies were the delight of our stay! We spent every morning having coffee on the balconies (our junior suite had two!), and we enjoyed lots of Bellinis by the pool, where a delightful server named Lauren served us with a smile and answered our hundreds of questions about the city. Dinner in the Mr. C restaurant was incredible, as expected. The staff was helpful with recommendations, and the service was impeccable. In addition to the outstanding cuisine and fabulous service, we enjoyed some great people-watching while we were there! If you're looking for some "famous" people, you might just see them in this restaurant! From arrival to departure, it was a fabulous experience. Anything we wanted/needed was just a phone call away, and after a five-day stay, we felt as if we knew the entire staff on a first-name basis! As a boutique hotel, the staff is actually able to get to know each visitor, making it feel very intimate. We loved every minute of our stay. Will we be back? You betcha! In fact, we hated to leave! It felt like we were leaving new-found friends! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre12_10
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Los Angeles for her twelfth birthday, a very special "girls trip". From the moment we checked in after a very long day and a very delayed flight this hotel, and their staff, could not have been more wonderful. The decor is simple and lux at the same time, which I really like. It was midnight when we checked in and they had given us a fantastic corner room with double balconies, but my daughter said she wished we could see the Hollywood sign, I figured, well, give it a try, and sure enough and they wisked us over to the other side of the hotel, perfect view. Then we shared a delicious hamburger through room service at 1:30 a.m. I could go on and on, but the staff is the key to this hotel. Genuinely friendly, always accommodating. The next day after we shopped we came back our room to find a piece of gourmet chocolate cake with a "Happy Birthday!"note for my daughter. Jessica at the front desk asked us each day what our plans were and recommended where to shop, where to eat, everything age appropriate for my daughter. She was as excited about our trip as we were! I loved the location. We did not visit the restaurant as we were doing more low key local dining, but it looked elegant. Hey, it's Ciprani! There was usually some kind of event in the evening and my daughter and I would watch from our balcony, Eloise style, as the fancy cars pull up.It was quiet but within walking distance to Rodeo Drive, Beverly Drive and Wilshire. The views were spectacular. I have stayed at many fine hotels in the world, and Mr. C's has everything that this traveler looks for- low key elegance and luxury, excellent food, the feeling that you are somewhere special, but right at home at the same time. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there whenever I have the opportunity to visit LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a BH hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kewlflower
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mr. C BH for our wedding anniversary. Too bad we could only stay one night because this was such a great deal for their July 4th promo. The entire experience was awesome from the minute we pulled into the parking lot to check out. The hotel is new so it was quiet (which we loved). We had a standard room on the 8th floor with a stunning view of the city. Room was huge (unlike boutique hotels) with two closets! love the decor and the clean look and feel of a new hotel. The sheets and bedding were perfect. We also received a complimentary bottle of Proseco and chocolates upon arrival. Not sure if that was standard or because we were celebrating our anniversary. Rodeo shopping is only a few minutes away so we just walked everywhere. We are definitely going back. Hopefully they retain their high level of service.

Reviews.Title: “A new hotel still has things to work on..”
Reviews.Author: OYKU
Reviews.Content: We are a young married couple who stayed at this hotel in mid june 2011 It is a chic hotel maybe better for business or age +40 Rooms are very good, well decorated smells new but sleeping quality in the rooms are bad because light in the balcony never goes off!! They say it is emergency lights that it's not possible to switch off.. the curtains are not enough as the light enters the room whole night.. if you are a person who can't sleep with light don't go to this hotel.. Another thing; they lost a box came for me more than 5 days!! so I had to think of it, call them twice a day to ask if they found it.. Employees don't know each other even the managers can't find out a person by his surname!! a box comes, somebody takes and signs for it.. than it gets lost.. they found it just 2 days before I leave the country.. If you won't have a shipment to the hotel and you can sleep with lights on : This is a brand new, well situated hotel for you.. by the way expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Standard”
Reviews.Author: Mishka_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mr C for 8 days in June 2011. The hotel had only re-opened (after major renovations and refurbishment) on 1st June 2011. The staff and service are second to none and definitely rivals any world class hotel I have I stay in around the world. The atmosphere, from the moment you pull up at the front, is welcoming and friendly. Nothing is too hard or too much for the staff and it is obvious they love their job and the hotel. I stayed on the 5th floor in a Deluxe City View room. I was fortunate to get a corner room with 2 balconies, one overlooking the gorgeous pool area, the other over-looking the city. The rooms are large and comfortable, with great amenities and layout. I don't think the room rates are high for this calibre of hotel. In fact, I would say the rates are quite low, compared to other 5 star hotels in the area and for what you get for your money. However, if you dine in the restaurant downstairs or order room service, or anything from bar or pool area, you will pay ridiculously high prices. A vodka/tonic by the pool cost me $24.95 but this was credited back to me when I complained about the price. There is no price list, so ask before you order. The restaurant menu and room service menu does have prices, but don't forget ... you have to tip also. There is a $4 surcharge for all room service orders, so bear that in mind, on top of what you order from the menu. Although the restaurant prices are high, after having breakfast and dinner in there a few times, the prices are on par with the quality of food, service and ambience. You will pay the same prices in any other restaurant in a 5 star hotel. I was blown away by this place. Everything about it oozes quality and luxury. I have read reviews that say the hotel and staff are obnoxious and pretentious. I would strongly disagree! If you want staff who are going to treat you like a backpacker, then go to a backpacker establishment. This is a world class hotel. The staff are trained to be friendly, courteous and obliging. I would say that some of the "A list" celebrity and affluent guests who stay and dine at the hotel are a little pretentious, but certainly not off-putting. This is what money buys ... luxury, fine wining and dining and an establishment that will spoil you. The only thing I had an issue with is the placement of the power points in the room. They are all tucked away behind items of large furniture. However, even this was quickly addressed with one of the staff members coming up to my room and plugging in a powerboard for me. This place is going to be near impossible to beat, for me anyway. Having stayed in more hotels than I can count, around most of the world, this will be THE hotel I stay in every time, whenever I am in Los Angeles. Whether you are on business or holiday or simply want to spoil someone for a night or 2, this place will not leave you disappointed. You will not want to leave. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: default41b
