Reviews.Content: We went to Mr C 10 days only after it had opened and we loved it! The hotel is very stylish and comfortable. The staff very helpful with advice etc. and extremely nice to us when they heard we were on our honeymoon. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget to pack your 3-Piece Suit & Maserati”
Reviews.Author: NycHFer21
Reviews.Content: From a traveler who loves an upscale, chic, & trendy scene wherever I choose to stay/eat/party - this hotel forces it so much so even I was left feeling luxury, wealth, and fabulous-ness were simply a recipe for uncomfortable. When entering, the hotel lobby appears a mix of old-school NYC Yale/Yacht/21 club lounge [tho modernized a bit] + high-end-home dining room / library-esque - which in LA, seems off. Its almost too open/airy in terms of spacing to feel intimate enough to share a drink as a couple or small group. The decor is high end and 'nice' but over-thought, and while you want to imagine a vibrant bunch of beautiful, well-dressed people standing around sipping belinis - in reality it would be entirely awkward for such a scene to take place in a location like this because of the lay-out and decor. As an aside, the bartenders stand on a lower level behind an expansive bar when entering, which is also just the wrong amount of edgy - the sofas in the lobby too deep to comfortably sit. Hotel staff & loiterers alike were nearly all dressed just a little too-nice for a mid June vacation/afternoon - groups of men in 3 piece suits on the pool deck & women in little black dresses around brunch time on sunday. High end cars frequented the premier 'show-off' parking spots at various times of the day - a white bentley affixed on the grass by the entry fountain, several black maseratis strewn about other locations midday seemed more like props - even in "kind-of Beverly Hills"- than actual guests' vehicles. The hallways are carpeted w/ a plush velour maroon or blue (depending on your floor) w/ walls that accent said colors (pink/baby blue) - which is kind of just like "huh?" The rooms are decent, not that large or small - the views from floors 2-9 on both sides leave a lot to be desired - especially "downtown facing" given you largely overlook a large shopping complex w/ glowing lights from the ever popular Ross's grocer - the pool deck has no views as it is surrounded entirely by concrete walls and a few oddly placed, very tall palm trees. The pool is incredibly small & most of the comfortable sofa-chairs are situated underneath said tall concrete walls blocking the sun - leaving guests to choose from oddly shaped lounger chairs or those which are non-cushioned. If you're looking for a nice, spacious cabana - this also is not the pool for you. We much rather preferred the views, pool deck, seating & overall 'scene' at the Mondrian LA, for instance. The location isn't great - cabs anywhere are a must - or you find yourself wandering through residential stretches or questionable strip mall lined streets - the complementary car service is sort of a farce - 1 car, fist come first serve. Mini gripes mostly associated w/ new hotel growing pains - our room wasn't ready at 3pm check-in, wireless internet runs the speed of dial-up, no #'s on the telephones, simple computer paper printed menu, no mini-bar price list, & no specified hotel concierge are all side complaints. My friend and I are in our late twenty's and feel this hotel caters more to the 35-40+ married couple, retiree, or business trip clientele. And even at that, hopefully you dress well, have frothy high end taste, and don't mind wondering every now and again if perhaps you're at the wrong place and instead stopped by a scene out of Mad Men - this would be the hotel for you. It's not for lack of trying - rather trying too hard.

Reviews.Title: “a day in heaven”
Reviews.Author: ericgh3
Reviews.Content: First of all the pool was extraordinary and relaxing. The service was outstanding and nothing like i have ever experienced in my life. The rooms were jaw dropping and very clean no dust, and looking through the crystal clear windows i saw and remarkable view of Los Angeles and the famous hollywood sign. Then i realized it was unmatchable any other hotel i have stayed at in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: BHfoodie
Reviews.Content: Not only is this not in Beverly Hills It is pretentious and overpriced and obnoxious. They got their friends to come on opening night and they will never have that kind of crowd again Beware. False advertising!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VladanT
Reviews.Content: Just a little outdated, this hotel made up with it's stylish decor and the location.
